refsynopsisdiv.title: Synopsis

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: GKeyFile lets you parse, edit or create files containing groups of key-value pairs, which we call key files for lack of a better name. Several freedesktop.org specifications use key files now, e.g the Desktop Entry Specification and the Icon Theme Specification.
The syntax of key files is described in detail in the Desktop Entry Specification, here is a quick summary: Key files consists of groups of key-value pairs, interspersed with comments.

informalexample.programlisting:
# this is just an example # there can be comments before the first group
[First Group]
Name=Key File Example\tthis value shows\nescaping
# localized strings are stored in multiple key-value pairs Welcome=Hello Welcome[de]=Hallo Welcome[fr]=Bonjour Welcome[it]=Ciao
[Another Group]
Numbers=2;20;-200;0
Booleans=true;false;true;true

refsect1.para: Lines beginning with a '#' and blank lines are considered comments.

Groups are started by a header line containing the group name enclosed in '[' and ']', and ended implicitly by the start of the next group or the end of the file. Each key-value pair must be contained in a group.

Key-value pairs generally have the form key=value, with the exception of localized strings, which have the form key[locale]=value. Space before and after the '=' character are ignored. Newline, tab, carriage return and backslash characters in value are escaped as \n, \t, \r, and \\, respectively. To preserve leading spaces in values, these can also be escaped as \s.

Key files can store strings (possibly with localized variants), integers, booleans and lists of these. Lists are separated by a separator character, typically ';' or ','. To use the list separator character in a value in a list, it has to be escaped by prefixing it with a backslash.

This syntax is obviously inspired by the .ini files commonly met on Windows, but there are some important differences:
.ini files use the ';' character to begin comments, key files use the '#' character.
Key files do not allow for ungrouped keys meaning only comments can precede the first group.
Key files are always encoded in UTF-8.
Key and Group names are case-sensitive, for example a group called [GROUP] is a different group from [group].
.ini files don't have a strongly typed boolean entry type, they only have GetProfileInt. In GKeyFile only true and false (in lower case) are allowed.

Note that in contrast to the Desktop Entry Specification, groups in key files may contain the same key multiple times; the last entry wins. Key files may also contain multiple groups with the same name; they are merged together. Another difference is that keys and group names in key files are not restricted to ASCII characters.

refsect2.title: GKeyFile
refsect2.programlisting: typedef struct _GKeyFile GKeyFile;
refsect2.para: The GKeyFile struct contains only private fields and should not be used directly.

refsect2.title: G_KEY_FILE_ERROR
refsect2.programlisting: #define G_KEY_FILE_ERROR g_key_file_error_quark()
refsect2.para: Error domain for key file parsing. Errors in this domain will be from the GKeyFileError enumeration. See GError for information on error domains.

refsect2.title: enum GKeyFileError
refsect2.para: Error codes returned by key file parsing.

listitem.simpara: the text being parsed was in an unknown encoding
a requested key was not found
a requested group was not found
a value could not be parsed

refsect2.title: enum GKeyFileFlags
refsect2.para: Flags which influence the parsing.

listitem.simpara: Use this flag if you plan to write the (possibly modified) contents of the key file back to a file; otherwise all comments will be lost when the key file is written back.
Use this flag if you plan to write the (possibly modified) contents of the key file back to a file; otherwise only the translations for the current language will be written back.

refsect2.title: g_key_file_new ()
refsect2.programlisting: GKeyFile* g_key_file_new (void);
refsect2.para: Creates a new empty GKeyFile object. Use g_key_file_load_from_file(), g_key_file_load_from_data(), g_key_file_load_from_dirs() or g_key_file_load_from_data_dirs() to read an existing key file.
Since 2.6

refsect2.title: g_key_file_free ()
refsect2.programlisting: void g_key_file_free (GKeyFile *key_file);
refsect2.para: Frees a GKeyFile.
Since 2.6

refsect2.title: g_key_file_set_list_separator ()
refsect2.programlisting: void g_key_file_set_list_separator (GKeyFile *key_file, gchar separator);
refsect2.para: Sets the character which is used to separate values in lists. Typically ';' or ',' are used as separators. The default list separator is ';'.
Since 2.6

refsect2.title: g_key_file_load_from_file ()
refsect2.programlisting: gboolean g_key_file_load_from_file (GKeyFile *key_file, const gchar *file, GKeyFileFlags flags, GError **error);
refsect2.para: Loads a key file into an empty GKeyFile structure. If the file could not be loaded then error is set to either a GFileError or GKeyFileError.

listitem.simpara: the path of a filename to load, in the GLib filename encoding
return location for a GError, or NULL
TRUE if a key file could be loaded, FALSE otherwise

refsect2.para: Since 2.6

refsect2.title: g_key_file_load_from_data ()
refsect2.programlisting: gboolean g_key_file_load_from_data (GKeyFile *key_file, const gchar *data, gsize length, GKeyFileFlags flags, GError **error);
refsect2.para: Loads a key file from memory into an empty GKeyFile structure. If the object cannot be created then error is set to a GKeyFileError.

listitem.simpara: the length of data in bytes
return location for a GError, or NULL
TRUE if a key file could be loaded, FALSE otherwise

refsect2.para: Since 2.6

refsect2.title: g_key_file_load_from_data_dirs ()
refsect2.programlisting: gboolean g_key_file_load_from_data_dirs (GKeyFile *key_file, const gchar *file, gchar **full_path, GKeyFileFlags flags, GError **error);
refsect2.para: This function looks for a key file named file in the paths returned from g_get_user_data_dir() and g_get_system_data_dirs(), loads the file into key_file and returns the file's full path in full_path. If the file could not be loaded then an error is set to either a GFileError or GKeyFileError.

listitem.simpara: a relative path to a filename to open and parse
return location for a string containing the full path of the file, or NULL
return location for a GError, or NULL
TRUE if a key file could be loaded, FALSE othewise

refsect2.para: Since 2.6

refsect2.title: g_key_file_load_from_dirs ()
refsect2.programlisting: gboolean g_key_file_load_from_dirs (GKeyFile *key_file, const gchar *file, const gchar **search_dirs, gchar **full_path, GKeyFileFlags flags, GError **error);
refsect2.para: This function looks for a key file named file in the paths specified in search_dirs, loads the file into key_file and returns the file's full path in full_path. If the file could not be loaded then an error is set to either a GFileError or GKeyFileError.

listitem.simpara: a relative path to a filename to open and parse
NULL-terminated array of directories to search
return location for a string containing the full path of the file, or NULL
return location for a GError, or NULL
TRUE if a key file could be loaded, FALSE otherwise

refsect2.para: Since 2.14

refsect2.title: g_key_file_to_data ()
refsect2.para: This function outputs key_file as a string.

listitem.simpara: return location for the length of the returned string, or NULL
return location for a GError, or NULL
a newly allocated string holding the contents of the GKeyFile

refsect2.para: Since 2.6

refsect2.title: g_key_file_get_start_group ()
refsect2.programlisting: gchar* g_key_file_get_start_group (GKeyFile *key_file);
refsect2.para: Returns the name of the start group of the file.

listitem.simpara: The start group of the key file.

refsect2.para: Since 2.6

refsect2.title: g_key_file_get_groups ()
refsect2.programlisting: gchar** g_key_file_get_groups (GKeyFile *key_file, gsize *length);
refsect2.para: Returns all groups in the key file loaded with key_file. The array of returned groups will be NULL-terminated, so length may optionally be NULL.

listitem.simpara: return location for the number of returned groups, or NULL
a newly-allocated NULL-terminated array of strings. Use g_strfreev() to free it.

refsect2.para: Since 2.6

refsect2.title: g_key_file_get_keys ()
refsect2.programlisting: gchar** g_key_file_get_keys (GKeyFile *key_file, const gchar *group_name, gsize *length, GError **error);
refsect2.para: Returns all keys for the group name group_name. The array of returned keys will be NULL-terminated, so length may optionally be NULL. In the event that the group_name cannot be found, NULL is returned and error is set to G_KEY_FILE_ERROR_GROUP_NOT_FOUND.

listitem.simpara: return location for the number of keys returned, or NULL
return location for a GError, or NULL
a newly-allocated NULL-terminated array of strings. Use g_strfreev() to free it.

refsect2.para: Since 2.6

refsect2.title: g_key_file_has_group ()
refsect2.programlisting: gboolean g_key_file_has_group (GKeyFile *key_file, const gchar *group_name);
refsect2.para: Looks whether the key file has the group group_name.

listitem.simpara: TRUE if group_name is a part of key_file, FALSE otherwise.

refsect2.para: Since 2.6

refsect2.title: g_key_file_has_key ()
refsect2.programlisting: gboolean g_key_file_has_key (GKeyFile *key_file, const gchar *group_name, const gchar *key, GError **error);
refsect2.para: Looks whether the key file has the key key in the group group_name.

listitem.simpara: TRUE if key is a part of group_name, FALSE otherwise.

refsect2.para: Since 2.6

refsect2.title: g_key_file_get_value ()
refsect2.programlisting: gchar* g_key_file_get_value (GKeyFile *key_file, const gchar *group_name, const gchar *key, GError **error);
refsect2.para: Returns the value associated with key under group_name.

In the event the key cannot be found, NULL is returned and error is set to G_KEY_FILE_ERROR_KEY_NOT_FOUND. In the event that the group_name cannot be found, NULL is returned and error is set to G_KEY_FILE_ERROR_GROUP_NOT_FOUND.

listitem.simpara: return location for a GError, or NULL
a newly allocated string or NULL if the specified key cannot be found.

refsect2.para: Since 2.6

refsect2.title: g_key_file_get_string ()
refsect2.programlisting: gchar* g_key_file_get_string (GKeyFile *key_file, const gchar *group_name, const gchar *key, GError **error);
refsect2.para: Returns the value associated with key under group_name.

In the event the key cannot be found, NULL is returned and error is set to G_KEY_FILE_ERROR_KEY_NOT_FOUND. In the event that the group_name cannot be found, NULL is returned and error is set to G_KEY_FILE_ERROR_GROUP_NOT_FOUND.

listitem.simpara: return location for a GError, or NULL
a newly allocated string or NULL if the specified key cannot be found.

refsect2.para: Since 2.6

refsect2.title: g_key_file_get_locale_string ()
refsect2.programlisting: gchar* g_key_file_get_locale_string (GKeyFile *key_file, const gchar *group_name, const gchar *key, const gchar *locale, GError **error);
refsect2.para: Returns the value associated with key under group_name translated in the given locale if available. If locale is NULL then the current locale is assumed.

If key cannot be found then NULL is returned and error is set to G_KEY_FILE_ERROR_KEY_NOT_FOUND. If the value associated with key cannot be interpreted or no suitable translation can be found then the untranslated value is returned.

listitem.simpara: return location for a GError, or NULL
a newly allocated string or NULL if the specified key cannot be found.

refsect2.para: Since 2.6

refsect2.title: g_key_file_get_boolean ()
refsect2.programlisting: gboolean g_key_file_get_boolean (GKeyFile *key_file, const gchar *group_name, const gchar *key, GError **error);
refsect2.para: Returns the value associated with key under group_name as a boolean.

If key cannot be found then FALSE is returned and error is set to G_KEY_FILE_ERROR_KEY_NOT_FOUND. Likewise, if the value associated with key cannot be interpreted as a boolean then FALSE is returned and error is set to G_KEY_FILE_ERROR_INVALID_VALUE.

listitem.simpara: the value associated with the key as a boolean, or FALSE if the key was not found or could not be parsed.

refsect2.para: Since 2.6

refsect2.title: g_key_file_get_integer ()
refsect2.programlisting: gint g_key_file_get_integer (GKeyFile *key_file, const gchar *group_name, const gchar *key, GError **error);
refsect2.para: Returns the value associated with key under group_name as an integer.

If key cannot be found then 0 is returned and error is set to G_KEY_FILE_ERROR_KEY_NOT_FOUND. Likewise, if the value associated with key cannot be interpreted as an integer then 0 is returned and error is set to G_KEY_FILE_ERROR_INVALID_VALUE.

listitem.simpara: the value associated with the key as an integer, or 0 if the key was not found or could not be parsed.

refsect2.para: Since 2.6

refsect2.title: g_key_file_get_double ()
refsect2.programlisting: gdouble g_key_file_get_double (GKeyFile *key_file, const gchar *group_name, const gchar *key, GError **error);
refsect2.para: Returns the value associated with key under group_name as a double. If group_name is NULL, the start_group is used.

If key cannot be found then 0.0 is returned and error is set to G_KEY_FILE_ERROR_KEY_NOT_FOUND. Likewise, if the value associated with key cannot be interpreted as a double then 0.0 is returned and error is set to G_KEY_FILE_ERROR_INVALID_VALUE.

listitem.simpara: the value associated with the key as a double, or 0.0 if the key was not found or could not be parsed.

refsect2.para: Since 2.12

refsect2.title: g_key_file_get_string_list ()
refsect2.programlisting: gchar** g_key_file_get_string_list (GKeyFile *key_file, const gchar *group_name, const gchar *key, gsize *length, GError **error);
refsect2.para: Returns the values associated with key under group_name.

In the event the key cannot be found, NULL is returned and error is set to G_KEY_FILE_ERROR_KEY_NOT_FOUND. In the event that the group_name cannot be found, NULL is returned and error is set to G_KEY_FILE_ERROR_GROUP_NOT_FOUND.

listitem.simpara: return location for the number of returned strings, or NULL
return location for a GError, or NULL
a NULL-terminated string array or NULL if the specified key cannot be found. The array should be freed with g_strfreev().

refsect2.para: Since 2.6

refsect2.title: g_key_file_get_locale_string_list ()
refsect2.programlisting: gchar** g_key_file_get_locale_string_list (GKeyFile *key_file, const gchar *group_name, const gchar *key, const gchar *locale, gsize *length, GError **error);
refsect2.para: Returns the values associated with key under group_name translated in the given locale if available. If locale is NULL then the current locale is assumed.

If key cannot be found then NULL is returned and error is set to G_KEY_FILE_ERROR_KEY_NOT_FOUND. If the values associated with key cannot be interpreted or no suitable translations can be found then the untranslated values are returned. The returned array is NULL-terminated, so length may optionally be NULL.

listitem.simpara: return location for the number of returned strings or NULL
return location for a GError or NULL
a newly allocated NULL-terminated string array or NULL if the key isn't found. The string array should be freed with g_strfreev().

refsect2.para: Since 2.6

refsect2.title: g_key_file_get_boolean_list ()
refsect2.programlisting: gboolean* g_key_file_get_boolean_list (GKeyFile *key_file, const gchar *group_name, const gchar *key, gsize *length, GError **error);
refsect2.para: Returns the values associated with key under group_name as booleans.

If key cannot be found then NULL is returned and error is set to G_KEY_FILE_ERROR_KEY_NOT_FOUND. Likewise, if the values associated with key cannot be interpreted as booleans then NULL is returned and error is set to G_KEY_FILE_ERROR_INVALID_VALUE.

listitem.simpara: the values associated with the key as a list of booleans, or NULL if the key was not found or could not be parsed.

refsect2.para: Since 2.6

refsect2.title: g_key_file_get_integer_list ()
refsect2.programlisting: gint* g_key_file_get_integer_list (GKeyFile *key_file, const gchar *group_name, const gchar *key, gsize *length, GError **error);
refsect2.para: Returns the values associated with key under group_name as integers.

If key cannot be found then NULL is returned and error is set to G_KEY_FILE_ERROR_KEY_NOT_FOUND. Likewise, if the values associated with key cannot be interpreted as integers then NULL is returned and error is set to G_KEY_FILE_ERROR_INVALID_VALUE.

listitem.simpara: the values associated with the key as a list of integers, or NULL if the key was not found or could not be parsed.

refsect2.para: Since 2.6

refsect2.title: g_key_file_get_double_list ()
refsect2.programlisting: gdouble* g_key_file_get_double_list (GKeyFile *key_file, const gchar *group_name, const gchar *key, gsize *length, GError **error);
refsect2.para: Returns the values associated with key under group_name as doubles.

If key cannot be found then NULL is returned and error is set to G_KEY_FILE_ERROR_KEY_NOT_FOUND. Likewise, if the values associated with key cannot be interpreted as doubles then NULL is returned and error is set to G_KEY_FILE_ERROR_INVALID_VALUE.

listitem.simpara: the values associated with the key as a list of doubles, or NULL if the key was not found or could not be parsed.

refsect2.para: Since 2.12

refsect2.title: g_key_file_get_comment ()
refsect2.programlisting: gchar* g_key_file_get_comment (GKeyFile *key_file, const gchar *group_name, const gchar *key, GError **error);
refsect2.para: Retrieves a comment above key from group_name. If key is NULL then comment will be read from above group_name. If both key and group_name are NULL, then comment will be read from above the first group in the file.

listitem.simpara: a comment that should be freed with g_free()

refsect2.para: Since 2.6

refsect2.title: g_key_file_set_value ()
refsect2.programlisting: void g_key_file_set_value (GKeyFile *key_file, const gchar *group_name, const gchar *key, const gchar *value);
refsect2.para: Associates a new value with key under group_name. If key cannot be found then it is created. If group_name cannot be found then it is created.
Since 2.6

refsect2.title: g_key_file_set_string ()
refsect2.programlisting: void g_key_file_set_string (GKeyFile *key_file, const gchar *group_name, const gchar *key, const gchar *string);
refsect2.para: Associates a new string value with key under group_name. If key cannot be found then it is created. If group_name cannot be found then it is created.
Since 2.6

refsect2.title: g_key_file_set_locale_string ()
refsect2.programlisting: void g_key_file_set_locale_string (GKeyFile *key_file, const gchar *group_name, const gchar *key, const gchar *locale, const gchar *string);
refsect2.para: Associates a string value for key and locale under group_name. If the translation for key cannot be found then it is created.
Since 2.6

refsect2.title: g_key_file_set_boolean ()
refsect2.programlisting: void g_key_file_set_boolean (GKeyFile *key_file, const gchar *group_name, const gchar *key, gboolean value);
refsect2.para: Associates a new boolean value with key under group_name. If key cannot be found then it is created.
Since 2.6

refsect2.title: g_key_file_set_integer ()
refsect2.programlisting: void g_key_file_set_integer (GKeyFile *key_file, const gchar *group_name, const gchar *key, gint value);
refsect2.para: Associates a new integer value with key under group_name. If key cannot be found then it is created.
Since 2.6

refsect2.title: g_key_file_set_double ()
refsect2.programlisting: void g_key_file_set_double (GKeyFile *key_file, const gchar *group_name, const gchar *key, gdouble value);
refsect2.para: Associates a new double value with key under group_name. If key cannot be found then it is created.
Since 2.12

refsect2.title: g_key_file_set_string_list ()
refsect2.programlisting: void g_key_file_set_string_list (GKeyFile *key_file, const gchar *group_name, const gchar *key, const gchar * const list[], gsize length);
refsect2.para: Associates a list of string values for key under group_name. If key cannot be found then it is created. If group_name cannot be found then it is created.

listitem.simpara: an array of locale string values
number of locale string values in list

refsect2.para: Since 2.6

refsect2.title: g_key_file_set_locale_string_list ()
refsect2.programlisting: void g_key_file_set_locale_string_list (GKeyFile *key_file, const gchar *group_name, const gchar *key, const gchar *locale, const gchar * const list[], gsize length);
refsect2.para: Associates a list of string values for key and locale under group_name. If the translation for key cannot be found then it is created.

listitem.simpara: a NULL-terminated array of locale string values

refsect2.para: Since 2.6

refsect2.title: g_key_file_set_boolean_list ()
refsect2.programlisting: void g_key_file_set_boolean_list (GKeyFile *key_file, const gchar *group_name, const gchar *key, gboolean list[], gsize length);
refsect2.para: Associates a list of boolean values with key under group_name. If key cannot be found then it is created. If group_name is NULL, the start_group is used.
Since 2.6

refsect2.title: g_key_file_set_integer_list ()
refsect2.programlisting: void g_key_file_set_integer_list (GKeyFile *key_file, const gchar *group_name, const gchar *key, gint list[], gsize length);
refsect2.para: Associates a list of integer values with key under group_name. If key cannot be found then it is created.

listitem.simpara: number of integer values in list

refsect2.para: Since 2.6

refsect2.title: g_key_file_set_double_list ()
refsect2.programlisting: void g_key_file_set_double_list (GKeyFile *key_file, const gchar *group_name, const gchar *key, gdouble list[], gsize length);
refsect2.para: Associates a list of double values with key under group_name. If key cannot be found then it is created.

listitem.simpara: number of double values in list

refsect2.para: Since 2.12

refsect2.title: g_key_file_set_comment ()
refsect2.programlisting: gboolean g_key_file_set_comment (GKeyFile *key_file, const gchar *group_name, const gchar *key, const gchar *comment, GError **error);
refsect2.para: Places a comment above key from group_name. If key is NULL then comment will be written above group_name. If both key and group_name are NULL, then comment will be written above the first group in the file.

listitem.simpara: TRUE if the comment was written, FALSE otherwise

refsect2.para: Since 2.6

refsect2.title: g_key_file_remove_group ()
refsect2.para: Removes the specified group, group_name, from the key file.

listitem.simpara: return location for a GError or NULL
TRUE if the group was removed, FALSE otherwise

refsect2.para: Since 2.6

refsect2.title: g_key_file_remove_key ()
refsect2.programlisting: gboolean g_key_file_remove_key (GKeyFile *key_file, const gchar *group_name, const gchar *key, GError **error);
refsect2.para: Removes key in group_name from the key file.

listitem.simpara: return location for a GError or NULL
TRUE if the key was removed, FALSE otherwise

refsect2.para: Since 2.6

refsect2.title: g_key_file_remove_comment ()
refsect2.programlisting: gboolean g_key_file_remove_comment (GKeyFile *key_file, const gchar *group_name, const gchar *key, GError **error);
refsect2.para: Removes a comment above key from group_name. If key is NULL then comment will be removed above group_name. If both key and group_name are NULL, then comment will be removed above the first group in the file.

listitem.simpara: TRUE if the comment was removed, FALSE otherwise

refsect2.para: Since 2.6

refsect2.title: G_KEY_FILE_DESKTOP_GROUP
refsect2.programlisting: #define G_KEY_FILE_DESKTOP_GROUP "Desktop Entry"
refsect2.para: The name of the main group of a desktop entry file, as defined in the Desktop Entry Specification. Consult the specification for more details about the meanings of the keys below.
Since 2.14

refsect2.title: G_KEY_FILE_DESKTOP_KEY_TYPE
refsect2.programlisting: #define G_KEY_FILE_DESKTOP_KEY_TYPE "Type"
refsect2.para: A key under G_KEY_FILE_DESKTOP_GROUP whose value is a string giving the type of the desktop entry. Usually G_KEY_FILE_DESKTOP_TYPE_APPLICATION, G_KEY_FILE_DESKTOP_TYPE_LINK, or G_KEY_FILE_DESKTOP_TYPE_DIRECTORY.
Since 2.14

refsect2.title: G_KEY_FILE_DESKTOP_KEY_VERSION
refsect2.programlisting: #define G_KEY_FILE_DESKTOP_KEY_VERSION "Version"
refsect2.para: A key under G_KEY_FILE_DESKTOP_GROUP whose value is a string giving the version of the Desktop Entry Specification used for the desktop entry file.
Since 2.14

refsect2.title: G_KEY_FILE_DESKTOP_KEY_NAME
refsect2.programlisting: #define G_KEY_FILE_DESKTOP_KEY_NAME "Name"
refsect2.para: A key under G_KEY_FILE_DESKTOP_GROUP whose value is a localized string giving the specific name of the desktop entry.
Since 2.14

refsect2.title: G_KEY_FILE_DESKTOP_KEY_GENERIC_NAME
refsect2.programlisting: #define G_KEY_FILE_DESKTOP_KEY_GENERIC_NAME "GenericName"
refsect2.para: A key under G_KEY_FILE_DESKTOP_GROUP whose value is a localized string giving the generic name of the desktop entry.
Since 2.14

refsect2.title: G_KEY_FILE_DESKTOP_KEY_NO_DISPLAY
refsect2.programlisting: #define G_KEY_FILE_DESKTOP_KEY_NO_DISPLAY "NoDisplay"
refsect2.para: A key under G_KEY_FILE_DESKTOP_GROUP whose value is a boolean stating whether the desktop entry should be shown in menus.
Since 2.14

refsect2.title: G_KEY_FILE_DESKTOP_KEY_COMMENT
refsect2.programlisting: #define G_KEY_FILE_DESKTOP_KEY_COMMENT "Comment"
refsect2.para: A key under G_KEY_FILE_DESKTOP_GROUP whose value is a localized string giving the tooltip for the desktop entry.
Since 2.14

refsect2.title: G_KEY_FILE_DESKTOP_KEY_ICON
refsect2.programlisting: #define G_KEY_FILE_DESKTOP_KEY_ICON "Icon"
refsect2.para: A key under G_KEY_FILE_DESKTOP_GROUP whose value is a localized string giving the name of the icon to be displayed for the desktop entry.
Since 2.14

refsect2.title: G_KEY_FILE_DESKTOP_KEY_HIDDEN
refsect2.programlisting: #define G_KEY_FILE_DESKTOP_KEY_HIDDEN "Hidden"
refsect2.para: A key under G_KEY_FILE_DESKTOP_GROUP whose value is a boolean stating whether the desktop entry has been deleted by the user.
Since 2.14

refsect2.title: G_KEY_FILE_DESKTOP_KEY_ONLY_SHOW_IN
refsect2.programlisting: #define G_KEY_FILE_DESKTOP_KEY_ONLY_SHOW_IN "OnlyShowIn"
refsect2.para: A key under G_KEY_FILE_DESKTOP_GROUP whose value is a list of strings identifying the environments that should display the desktop entry.
Since 2.14

refsect2.title: G_KEY_FILE_DESKTOP_KEY_NOT_SHOW_IN
refsect2.programlisting: #define G_KEY_FILE_DESKTOP_KEY_NOT_SHOW_IN "NotShowIn"
refsect2.para: A key under G_KEY_FILE_DESKTOP_GROUP whose value is a list of strings identifying the environments that should not display the desktop entry.
Since 2.14

refsect2.title: G_KEY_FILE_DESKTOP_KEY_TRY_EXEC
refsect2.programlisting: #define G_KEY_FILE_DESKTOP_KEY_TRY_EXEC "TryExec"
refsect2.para: A key under G_KEY_FILE_DESKTOP_GROUP whose value is a string giving the file name of a binary on disk used to determine if the program is actually installed. It is only valid for desktop entries with the Application type.
Since 2.14

refsect2.title: G_KEY_FILE_DESKTOP_KEY_EXEC
refsect2.programlisting: #define G_KEY_FILE_DESKTOP_KEY_EXEC "Exec"
refsect2.para: A key under G_KEY_FILE_DESKTOP_GROUP whose value is a string giving the command line to execute. It is only valid for desktop entries with the Application type.
Since 2.14

refsect2.title: G_KEY_FILE_DESKTOP_KEY_PATH
refsect2.programlisting: #define G_KEY_FILE_DESKTOP_KEY_PATH "Path"
refsect2.para: A key under G_KEY_FILE_DESKTOP_GROUP whose value is a string containing the working directory to run the program in. It is only valid for desktop entries with the Application type.
Since 2.14

refsect2.title: G_KEY_FILE_DESKTOP_KEY_TERMINAL
refsect2.programlisting: #define G_KEY_FILE_DESKTOP_KEY_TERMINAL "Terminal"
refsect2.para: A key under G_KEY_FILE_DESKTOP_GROUP whose value is a boolean stating whether the program should be run in a terminal window. It is only valid for desktop entries with the Application type.
Since 2.14

refsect2.title: G_KEY_FILE_DESKTOP_KEY_MIME_TYPE
refsect2.programlisting: #define G_KEY_FILE_DESKTOP_KEY_MIME_TYPE "MimeType"
refsect2.para: A key under G_KEY_FILE_DESKTOP_GROUP whose value is a list of strings giving the MIME types supported by this desktop entry.
Since 2.14

refsect2.title: G_KEY_FILE_DESKTOP_KEY_CATEGORIES
refsect2.programlisting: #define G_KEY_FILE_DESKTOP_KEY_CATEGORIES "Categories"
refsect2.para: A key under G_KEY_FILE_DESKTOP_GROUP whose value is a list of strings giving the categories in which the desktop entry should be shown in a menu.
Since 2.14

refsect2.title: G_KEY_FILE_DESKTOP_KEY_STARTUP_NOTIFY
refsect2.programlisting: #define G_KEY_FILE_DESKTOP_KEY_STARTUP_NOTIFY "StartupNotify"
refsect2.para: A key under G_KEY_FILE_DESKTOP_GROUP whose value is a boolean stating whether the application supports the Startup Notification Protocol Specification.
Since 2.14

refsect2.title: G_KEY_FILE_DESKTOP_KEY_STARTUP_WM_CLASS
refsect2.programlisting: #define G_KEY_FILE_DESKTOP_KEY_STARTUP_WM_CLASS "StartupWMClass"
refsect2.para: A key under G_KEY_FILE_DESKTOP_GROUP whose value is string identifying the WM class or name hint of a window that the application will create, which can be used to emulate Startup Notification with older applications.
Since 2.14

refsect2.title: G_KEY_FILE_DESKTOP_KEY_URL
refsect2.programlisting: #define G_KEY_FILE_DESKTOP_KEY_URL "URL"
refsect2.para: A key under G_KEY_FILE_DESKTOP_GROUP whose value is a string giving the URL to access. It is only valid for desktop entries with the Link type.
Since 2.14

refsect2.title: G_KEY_FILE_DESKTOP_TYPE_APPLICATION
refsect2.programlisting: #define G_KEY_FILE_DESKTOP_TYPE_APPLICATION "Application"
refsect2.para: The value of the G_KEY_FILE_DESKTOP_KEY_TYPE key for desktop entries representing applications.
Since 2.14

refsect2.title: G_KEY_FILE_DESKTOP_TYPE_LINK
refsect2.programlisting: #define G_KEY_FILE_DESKTOP_TYPE_LINK "Link"
refsect2.para: The value of the G_KEY_FILE_DESKTOP_KEY_TYPE key for desktop entries representing links to documents.
Since 2.14

refsect2.title: G_KEY_FILE_DESKTOP_TYPE_DIRECTORY
refsect2.programlisting: #define G_KEY_FILE_DESKTOP_TYPE_DIRECTORY "Directory"
refsect2.para: The value of the G_KEY_FILE_DESKTOP_KEY_TYPE key for desktop entries representing directories.
Since 2.14
